channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description:
I think this is what you'll regret at 80. That you aren't 20.
And btw it's because sex is great at 20.
So if you're 20 you should do a lot of that.
At least it'll make you smile when you're 80 (I imagine).

I hope they're misquoting Bezos, given how journalism works, I'd bet they are. https://t.co/poq4tNvUHu
apparently he did say it.
@TommyBeer yes but some part of that is the other teams learned how to neutralize randle but haven't learned anything about topin.

@ElieNYC The same country absorbed over 1 million deaths from Covid, many of which were preventable, maybe all of them.
@ElieNYC The problem imho is that we're organized to be stupid, politically, no one has invested in making us organized intelligently, even those of us who are curious, educated, who want to do good. Our only outlet is to give money and vote.
@electrojcr Hmm yeah I don't see that in the Constitution.
@DBaird13 The thing that really gives me pride is that it can serve as an example to young developers that their work can make a difference, and it isn't all about making huge piles of money.

Every time I hear someone talk about podcasting in such a mainstream way I feel a sense of accomplishment. Podcasting made a difference. It worked. ;-) https://t.co/SrN7Q34cJE
Evan Williams and the team at Blogger should feel that pride too, Twitter made a big difference. Yes he got a few billion more dollars than I did, but I never cared about money beyond enough to buy my own freedom, which I got before the web became a thing.

This is outrageous. It's fine if Justice Kavanaugh feels so empowered to force women to carry pregnancy to term, or even give up their lives, but he should get ready for lots of "politics," and forget out a nice dinner out with the family. That part of his life is over. https://t.co/8oMKmrVmEZ
New dominant Omicron COVID subvariant defies immunity from previous infections. https://t.co/Wb8gbQjrc6
Twitter Is Ready for a Potential Legal Battle With Elon Musk. https://t.co/QHwpYv9ZmP
When a basketball team is as bad as the Supreme Court, standard procedure is to tear the whole thing down and start over.
Majority in U.S. Disapprove of Supreme Court Abortion Decision Overturning Roe v. Wade. https://t.co/C1hKQW12BE

The Every Lot bots are a family of Twitter bots that post Google Streetview photographs of every property in tax records, in numerical order by tax id. Each bot will take around thirty years to post images of the entire city. https://t.co/PxaMMSAofj

1/2 I didn't watch the conference with @semaforben, but I sure heard a lot about it -- and it seems they're missing the big niche that none of the pubs old or new seem interested in. It's the idea I gave the @martinn123 in 2001, find all the sources, people with expertise and
2/2 give them a home. We already have too many legit journalism outlets competing to be number one, how about something truly different, instead of all the news that's fit to print, or democracy dies in darkness, make your mission to save the world.
@b0rk your stuff is great. you're such a good writer and presenter. and the ideas are solid. thanks.
This never made any sense to me. You live in NYC where you can get actual pizza. https://t.co/1YGI2xH9VE
Six ways Biden could use his executive powers to support abortion rights now. https://t.co/IBcXtr1Pey

The other day I replied to a tweet by a famous columnist and even though the trolls couldn't reply, a number of them did QT it with the usual crap. Then I remembered I had turned the quality filter off. I turned it on and they went away. As if they never existed.
"People don't click links in Twitter." Yes I see the irony of this tweet. Prove me wrong and click the link anyway. ðŸ˜€ https://t.co/Gcbvt0URqm
2015: People don't click on links. It's not just true of mobile readers, it's true of all readers, everywhere, all the time. They. Don't. Click. Links. Memorize that. https://t.co/Gcbvt0URqm
Could the US supreme court give state legislatures unchecked election powers? https://t.co/qtsJbf2q9H
Instead of abortion or pro-choice could we talk about Reproductive Rights?

BTW -- to @twitterdev -- is there an API for Notes? This is a crucial question. If yes, then devs will be able to hook great editorial tools to Twitter in ways no one has been able to do before. It will open so many doors not just for Twitter, but for the entire net.
My writeup of Twitter Notes, based on seeing one in the wild.
https://t.co/Nn8chXmoV6

I have finally seen a Twitter Note in the wild. I like everything I see, but how it presents in the Twitter timeline. I suggest that presenting notes as they present an image or video -- inline. I did a mockup of how this would work... https://t.co/g7spyCtQ4P
The way they present it now, i think most users will see the links to notes as they see all other links, not worth the trouble. By putting it inline, they start reading, and when they want more, they just click the more link.
There's great prior art for this -- Facebook. It works there, it would work great on Twitter.
I would use the feature and provide the highest quality technical feedback. I have decades of experience at this, esp in this area, having written the first blogging tools.
The end of Netflixâ€™s culture of feedback. https://t.co/DSmws7GqvN
